alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Mason; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mason, northern Putnam, west central Roane and southeastern Jackson Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buffalo, or 7 miles northwest of Winfield, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ripley, Eleanor, Buffalo, Kenna, Statts Mills, Harmony, Given, Kentuck, Fraziers Bottom, Fairplain, Gay, Gandeeville and Liberty. This includes Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 121 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for central, western and northwestern West Virginia.
